conclusion: Analyze figures to understand relationship between electric potential, acceleration, and electric force.
Image (a) shows points A, B, M, N with O as midpoint of line AB; M and N on perpendicular bisector.
Image (b) shows variation of electric potential φ along ON with respect to position x.
Image (c) shows variation of acceleration a along ON with respect to position x.
Electric potential φ at point N is 4kQ/3L.
Electric potential at point M is zero, as it is at infinity.
Potential difference between points M and N is Δφ = 4kQ/3L.
Acceleration a at point N is 2g, while at point M, it is g.
Acceleration difference between points M and N is Δa = g.
Electric force F can be determined using F = Δa · Q.
Magnitude of electric force experienced by small ball at point M is gQ.
